summary:
WOW.
I loved this movie😍
I loved everything about it, the cast, the plot, the directors and the crew. They did an amazing job, I...
caption:
WOW.
I loved this movie😍
I loved everything about it, the cast, the plot, the directors and the crew. They did an amazing job, I want to see Captain Marvel again and again.
I loved how @brielarson portrayed Carol and I loved @samuelljackson performance (as always), we finally got to see more of him!
After this the haters can just 🙊 off❤️❤️
I recommend y'all to see it as soon as possible💕
-
-

summary: Theory about what Marvel is planning for Dracula
title: Theory about what Marvel is planning for Dracula
body:
I have a theory for what Marvel is planning for Dracula.    

Now that Marvel is writing fun and creative stories again (Yay!) I have a theory about what they’re planning for Dracula.  The implication is that he is going to die in the next issue but I don’t think that’s what’s going to ultimately happen.  It might happen temporarily. 


 (Marvel: “No, he’s dead forever and ever and ever!  We really mean it this time!”  Me: “Yeah, okay…) How many times did Marvel kill off  Dracula in the 70s alone?

I suspect that Marvel plans on using Dracula in a whole new way.

They say that in the next issue the “Final fate of Dracula” is revealed and “Leaving the vampires of the Marvel universe forever changed.  Who will be the new leader of The damned?”  (Yeah, sure, he’s dead forever…  We believe you…)

In Avengers issue 16 (2019) we see Dracula threatened with the slow, torturous death of his previous lovers with the only sign of mercy being a faster death for them.  This sets the groundwork for a delicious revenge story.   I think Dracula is being redeveloped as an anti-hero and this is not a bad thing. 

I think there is a simple but calculated reason behind this.  And the answer is Sony’s Morbius.   Marvel wants a vampire hero in play (or anti-hero) but not the broody and byronic Morbius just to promote Sony’s new film.   Who better than Count Dracula himself? 

   What if the real reason they’ll need a new king is Dracula renounces his own title? He seems like he currently wants to die (which is very out-of-character for him) but revenge might be a good catalyst to invigorate him.  

I don’t want a wishy-washy broody Dracula.  I’d rather an anti-hero version that is more likely to leave his enemies impaled outside The Avengers Tower…  I just hope they know how to achieve the latter.  Vicious and predatory yet sympathetic.  (Someone make the writers watch Castlevania!  …or read Fred Saberhagen’s Dracula books.)  

(Image from Boom Comics’ Dracula: The Company of Monsters) 

Despite being usually a villain, Dracula is a creature of honor and rules of chivalry and hospitality.  That’s why he worked together with Captain America against the Nazis during World War 2 (Avengers Assemble).   So surrendering himself to captivity only for his lovers to be rounded up and killed slowly for his knowledge, with the only reprieve being a faster death for them, this may piss him off quite a bit.

summary:
“Steve!”
“Y/n,” he sighed, relief settling over his features. Separated, as if you were criminals. Your voice caught his...
body:
“Steve!”

“Y/n,” he sighed, relief settling over his features. Separated, as if you were criminals. Your voice caught his attention, making him stop in his tracks. His frantic eyes finally settling on you, the both of you in handcuffs, arrested and interrogated for something you weren’t even involved in. He’d tried to tell them that, to give an explication, but no one would listen.

They pushed you apart, pulling you in different directions. You didn’t want to be alone, calling for him, for the rest of your teammates. They had to be here somewhere, all you had to do was find them. They tried to get you to stop, shushing and pushing you along. Whatever it was they were interested in, they wouldn’t get it from you.

They pushed you apart, pulling you in different directions. You didn’t want to be alone, calling for him, for the rest of your teammates. They had to be here somewhere, all you had to do was find them. They tried to get you to stop, shushing and pushing you along. Whatever it was they were interested in, they wouldn’t get it from you.

tags: like yes! I'm excited for the future
with CM and other leading ladies!
that it took them so long
to realize that Women Can Earn Them Money
summary: “Shes not alone” certainly feels tacked on and not enough but it’s a fresh relief from the last ten years of representation...
question: “Shes not alone” certainly feels tacked on and not enough but it’s a fresh relief from the last ten years of representation desert. It feels like things are turning for the better in that arena with CM and the future leading ladies of the mcu. Should we expect more as far as representation and respecting and utilizing female characters? Absolutely. *cough cough gamora* But I still think it’s a cool moment, a nod to how far we’ve come at least. And I still cheer, cuz my girls are badass.
answer: Like, I see where you’re coming from, but they very easily could’ve had a Moment™ without making it as cheesy as they did. And it feels forced because like….neither of those women have had cheesy moments in the past. Like, I think the ‘why has she been up there this whole time?’ bit worked better for them. Honestly, the only way I could see that ‘she’s not alone’™ not feeling forced is if it was said by like, Gamora or Nebula, or even Mantis? We’ve seen Nat, Wanda and Okoye being comfortable on teams in the past, that’s not really like. an issue for them. they didn’t really *need* a whole moment of solidarity because they had already previously accepted each other as fighters and somewhat partners. It would have been way more impactful if it was said by one of the guardian ladies, sisters finally completely affirming they have each others back, or someone affirming Mantis is truly Part Of The Team since the last time we saw her she was literally a slave who had barely interacted with anyone before. but the franchise uhhh kinda has refused to show any thread of respect to Nebula and Mantis so far, and Gamora had already been senselessly slaughtered just for the sake of manpain, and literally No Other God Damn Women Were In The Movie For Longer Than 2 Minutes, so it just got shoved onto those three like during reshoots someone was like ‘oooh shit what’s that lesbian test people use on movies!!!! throw something in there for that so we pass!!!!’ and it’s. eye roll worthy lmao

reblog.comment: Like, I see where you’re coming from, but they very easily could’ve had a Moment™ without making it as cheesy as they did. And it feels forced because like….neither of those women have had cheesy moments in the past. Like, I think the ‘why has she been up there this whole time?’ bit worked better for them. Honestly, the only way I could see that ‘she’s not alone’™ not feeling forced is if it was said by like, Gamora or Nebula, or even Mantis? We’ve seen Nat, Wanda and Okoye being comfortable on teams in the past, that’s not really like. an issue for them. they didn’t really *need* a whole moment of solidarity because they had already previously accepted each other as fighters and somewhat partners. It would have been way more impactful if it was said by one of the guardian ladies, sisters finally completely affirming they have each others back, or someone affirming Mantis is truly Part Of The Team since the last time we saw her she was literally a slave who had barely interacted with anyone before. but the franchise uhhh kinda has refused to show any thread of respect to Nebula and Mantis so far, and Gamora had already been senselessly slaughtered just for the sake of manpain, and literally No Other God Damn Women Were In The Movie For Longer Than 2 Minutes, so it just got shoved onto those three like during reshoots someone was like ‘oooh shit what’s that lesbian test people use on movies!!!! throw something in there for that so we pass!!!!’ and it’s. eye roll worthy lmao

trail.content_raw: Like, I see where you’re coming from, but they very easily could’ve had a Moment™ without making it as cheesy as they did. And it feels forced because like….neither of those women have had cheesy moments in the past. Like, I think the ‘why has she been up there this whole time?’ bit worked better for them. Honestly, the only way I could see that ‘she’s not alone’™ not feeling forced is if it was said by like, Gamora or Nebula, or even Mantis? We’ve seen Nat, Wanda and Okoye being comfortable on teams in the past, that’s not really like. an issue for them. they didn’t really *need* a whole moment of solidarity because they had already previously accepted each other as fighters and somewhat partners. It would have been way more impactful if it was said by one of the guardian ladies, sisters finally completely affirming they have each others back, or someone affirming Mantis is truly Part Of The Team since the last time we saw her she was literally a slave who had barely interacted with anyone before. but the franchise uhhh kinda has refused to show any thread of respect to Nebula and Mantis so far, and Gamora had already been senselessly slaughtered just for the sake of manpain, and literally No Other God Damn Women Were In The Movie For Longer Than 2 Minutes, so it just got shoved onto those three like during reshoots someone was like ‘oooh shit what’s that lesbian test people use on movies!!!! throw something in there for that so we pass!!!!’ and it’s. eye roll worthy lmao
trail.content: Like, I see where you’re coming from, but they very easily could’ve had a Moment™ without making it as cheesy as they did. And it feels forced because like….neither of those women have had cheesy moments in the past. Like, I think the ‘why has she been up there this whole time?’ bit worked better for them. Honestly, the only way I could see that ‘she’s not alone’™ not feeling forced is if it was said by like, Gamora or Nebula, or even Mantis? We’ve seen Nat, Wanda and Okoye being comfortable on teams in the past, that’s not really like. an issue for them. they didn’t really *need* a whole moment of solidarity because they had already previously accepted each other as fighters and somewhat partners. It would have been way more impactful if it was said by one of the guardian ladies, sisters finally completely affirming they have each others back, or someone affirming Mantis is truly Part Of The Team since the last time we saw her she was literally a slave who had barely interacted with anyone before. but the franchise uhhh kinda has refused to show any thread of respect to Nebula and Mantis so far, and Gamora had already been senselessly slaughtered just for the sake of manpain, and literally No Other God Damn Women Were In The Movie For Longer Than 2 Minutes, so it just got shoved onto those three like during reshoots someone was like ‘oooh shit what’s that lesbian test people use on movies!!!! throw something in there for that so we pass!!!!’ and it’s. eye roll worthy lmao

summary: Concept: In “Avengers: Endgame”, during the final battle with Thanos, Peter Quill brings back the dance-off in order to distract...
body:
Concept:

In “Avengers: Endgame”, during the final battle with Thanos, Peter Quill brings back the dance-off in order to distract Thanos long enough for Nebula to steal the gauntlet. Peter Q gets everyone else to dance along as well.

Peter Parker does the really awkward, Spider-Man 3 dance.

Gamora actually dances this time around and she’s really good. 

Carol Danvers dances off-beat and when Quill asks what she’s doing, Carol says she was humming (insert 1990s grunge band here) in her head. 

Steve Rogers fidgets around a bit because he doesn’t know what to do. 

T’Challa looks at everyone disappointed while Shuri films the whole thing on her phone. 

Tony is also disappointed but then sees Doctor Strange dancing. Tony asks, “Strange…what the hell are you doing?” and Strange says, completely serious, “I’m dancing to save the universe. So shut up and dance already”.

summary: So today in the bus, a boy was talking to his friend about Marvel.
body:
So today in the bus, a boy was talking to his friend about Marvel.

So I was listening to them.

Then the boy said, that Peter Parker was dead.

So looked at him with a death-look and now I think he is afraid of me.
